Edited November 30, 2015 by Cydonian Monk

Avatar isn't that "space" either. Of course we're in future, on distant moon few lightyears away from Earth, but again, we see space as space in first few seconds of the movie. Rest of it is more like Pocahontas far far away.

Also it's "The Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy."

The field is too vast to have just one, and vague to define exactly what you mean by "Space Movie." E.T. comes from space, but the movie never showed anything outside of Earth's atmosphere. Iron Man and Iron Man 2 went higher up, could they be "Space" movies?

Of the ones listed, it has to be the original "Alien".  I was 17 when it came out, and just old enough to get in as an adult, and bring along my little brother.  Now we had grown up on Sci-fi movies, and thought we sere just going to see another typical bug-eyed space monster movie....

We were so very, very wrong!  I was on the edge of my seat the whole movie, really horrified and loving it at the same time!  The effects were so good for the late 70's, and also so very dark.  And this was the first really believable alien or ship I ever remember seeing on film.  It scared me like no other movie, and I loved it!

I am still a big fan, and now own 5 of H.R. Giger's books, including Necronomicon's I & II, and The Making of Alien.
